current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
Expressing the Sense of the Senate regarding the use of electronic devices on the floor of the
			 Senate.

cosponsor.#tail: ) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the

text.#text: That it is the Sense of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
are necessary and proper
			 in the
			 conduct of official

business, would  not distract, interrupt, or
			 inconvenience the business of Members of the Senate, and should therefore
			 be permissible, including—

text.#text: certain uses of electronic devices by Senators on the floor of the

delivering floor remarks from text displayed on personal digital assistant devices and tablet
			 computers;

reviewing and editing documents on personal digital assistant devices and tablet computers while
			 seated or standing at a desk, except
			 when the Senator who wishes to use the device holds the floor or seeks to
			 be recognized; and

sending email and other data communication using personal digital assistant devices and tablet
			 computers while seated or standing at a desk, except when the Senator who
			 wishes to use the device holds the
			 floor or seeks to be recognized;
necessary and proper uses of electronic devices on the floor of the

transmitting sound for any purpose other than through earphones or in such a manner as would not
			 disturb proceedings on the floor of the
using telephones or other devices for voice communication; or
using desktop computers, laptop computers, or other large devices;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
should consider an amendment to the Rules for the
			 Regulation
			 of the Senate Wing consistent with the principles stated above; and

text.#text:
any amendment to the Rules for the Regulation of the Senate Wing should take into account possible
			 future changes in technology.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 SRES 385 IS: Expressing the Sense of the Senate regarding the use of electronic devices on the floor of the Senate.
